text: Inhibition of activation of transcription factor AP-1 by <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signalling in human T-cells .

Co - stimulation of T-lymphocytes by T-cell receptor ( TcR ) occupancy and activation of the <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> surface molecule results in enhanced proliferation and <extra_id_0> interleukin 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) production .

text: The increase in <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression triggered by <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> involves a kappa B-like sequence in the 5' - regulatory region of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter , called <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - responsive element .

text: Stimulation of T-cells by agonistic anti - <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibodies in conjunction with phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( PMA ) - or TcR - derived signals induces the enhanced activation of the transcription factor NF-kappa B .
Here we report that <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> engagement , however , exerts opposite effects on the transcription factor AP-1 .

Whereas anti - <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> together with PMA increased the DNA binding and trans-activation activity of NF-kappa B , PMA - induced activation of AP-1 was significantly suppressed .
The inhibitory effect exerted by anti - <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was observed at the level of DNA binding as well as in functional reporter-gene assays .
These results suggest that the two transcription factors are independently regulated and may perform different functions during T-cell activation .
